title: Connection issues with the UI/Spectate
body:
I'm unable to view ranked games at times. The lower right either displays as such, or says Connection Lost with the option to refresh. 

I've been unable to spectate games for more than a week, with attempts resulting in a black screen, or if it somehow does load, the game is mostly frozen.

replies.body: Having the same issue, but it literally just happened now. Before today it was fine, but now whenever I try to spectate it takes forever to load the players. Then it tells me "can't connect to spectator data" and closes. I don't think it's the patch in this case. It's frustrating, nonetheless, since it appears to be happening for no reason.

Made it through the firewall steps OK.  Then I made it as far as to the part where they want me to install java to run the network analyzer, and you know, friends don't let friends install java.  So I'm done, but maybe a more spirited volunteer can submit information.

The troublesome thing about it is at one point it worked, and with literally no software or configuration modifications to the computer  except a new a League of Legends  patch, it suddenly stops, so it has that anecdotal feeling that its all League.  But I do understand there are growing pains as well, as backend technology needs to be upgraded and secured.

Thanks for helping out DArtagnan.

Same here. When I try to spectate a friend's game, I get the message ”can't connect to spectator server. Would you like to retry?” 
LoL servers is messing up alot recently.

same but store+spectate
plus both are intermittent ie on/off
I have the same thing going on. It has been doping this for a week now. Also have trouble logging in all the time.

Hello Caraway (and others)!

I went ahead and opened my own client to make sure that the Spectator Window was showing correctly.  It appears to be working normally, which leads me to think that there is something else going on.  When we've received tickets about this previously, it usually involves a type of connection issue where the main game can connect, but not the spectator client/servers.    The steps here usually resolve this issue:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues

There are quite a number of steps there, but every single one is crucial in helping make sure that you can properly connect to our Spectator Servers.  If you are still not able to see the Spectator Box on the Client, or spectate games, make sure to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to our Tech Team!  They can work with you one-on-one in order to get this issue resolved!  If you do submit a ticket, include these logs as well:

1) Network Analysis: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1

2) NetworkInfo Log: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4

3) Process List: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3

I believe the problem is not with being able to "see" the games on the Landing Page but rather While Spectating the games themselves. The games  freeze. I get a Popup window that says "Download Failed... Unable To Download Spectator Data. The Game Will Now Exit." after roughly 16 mins of spectating. Also the download bar starts off at 100%, but begins to decrease after 18 mins has downloaded as shown in the attached image. The clock continues to increase in game time, but nothing plays, and the players stand still, sometimes even doing their, standing moves, while minions fight and glitch. 

http://dilaryn.com/20141223_080845.jpg

I can spectate games on the PBE fine. The spectator window on the Launch Page is fully operational. It's spectating the games on the Launch Page that is impossible. The image below in my previous post is what happens every time. It's been happening since 4.12 update.

Hey Dartagnan,

Im having this issue too, since the last patch. I make a living as a network administrator, pretty sure the patch broke something as my end checks out.

Can you supply IP address(es) to the spectate servers so I can narrow things down?
I'm having this exact issue now. I have a ticket into Riot, hopefully we're going to work this out.

*bump*

5.1 has appeared not to fix anything.  

Btw I have an IPv6 capable connection with hardware, router, modem, and compatible ISP.  Do you think this is part of the problem?

But even if you guys don't have it, it should negotiate IPv4.  What's going on with NA servers?

Heh Dartagnan, there are a lot of threads popping up about this issue.  also this other one as well - http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/QE9nsvbE-client-spectator-mode-not-working-after-421

Briefly I'd like to mention that if I spectate a game even though it can give me an error or time out, SOMETIMES it lets me get in and spectate -- but after a couple of seconds the champions will start running into walls and minions stop moving.

But the really interesting point I'd like to add is when this is happening, if a friend who does not experience the issue right clicks on my name and selects "spectate", HE will experience the issue, until he spectates from another source (like the homescreen games dashboard).  I don't know if that information will help, but I think its relevant.  The information representing my spectation session that might be pulled to the other player, so that information for me is being generated incorrectly or as a corrupt record.
I can't spectate on a friend's game or the dashboard selection of games. None of the spectating works except on the PBE server. There I can spectate fine, just not on NA server.

Alright I'm short on time but I decided to take a look at it with Microsoft Network Monitor, a free tool distributed by Microsoft on their website, for analyzing packet data.

I noticed a lot of SYN / ACK mismatch in building the TCP window with spectator.na1.lol.riotgames.com.  The amazonaws thing (no idea what that is) seems to sync fine.  Some SYN requests were not receiving their corresponding ACK, and thus re-sending.  Then further down the stack  duplicate ACK requests were received.  Its not just in the negotiation, also the TCP sequence numbers for general information requests kept re-transmitting.  Sometimes more data went through than others.

I'll have to reflect on these logs awhile.
